fn.p: Independent-sample t-test was used; TIV = total intracranial volume; SD = standard deviation; NA = not applicable; NS = not significant.

tr.td: ICA based RSFC comparison before and after speech therapy.
P < 0.05, corrected by Monte Carlo simulation, individual voxel p < 0.001, cluster volume>327 mm3.
RSFC was decreased in the cerebellum after therapy to the level of fluent controls.
P < 0.05, corrected by family-wise error (FWE) and cluster size <35 voxels.

Reduced FC between the posterior language reception area and anterior brain regions related to initiation of speech motor, but increased FC within anterior/posterior speech associated regions in the PDS group
voxel-wise p < 0.005 uncorrected with cluster size >64 voxels correspondingto p < 0.03 whole brain corrected using Monte Carlo simulation.
Decreased connectivity between the basal ganglia and right SMA, as well as bilateral STG, but increased connectivity between the cerebellum and right IFG in the PDS group
voxel-based p < 0.005 was corrected to be an equivalent whole-brain p < 0.032
Reduced FC in networks that support self-initiated timing of speech movement, and integration of auditory feedback to speech motor control processes in stuttering children
Increased FC between cerebellum and thalamus, but decreased FC within the perisylvian auditory, motor, and speech planning regions in the PDS group
Voxel-wise p < 0.001 uncorrected, cluster p < 3.76×10−4FDR corrected
Decreased FC between MidFGl and right motor areas, as well as between STGl and several brain regions including the right limbic lobe and right cerebellum in the PDS subjects
